intro: Bulbophyllum popayanense, commonly known as the Popayán orchid, is a species native to Colombia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, intricate floral structure. The plant produces striking, often fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on trees or rocks in the cloud forests of its native region. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated by enthusiasts, though it remains a rare and specialized species.
